DOCNAME: CASE OF KOŘÍNEK AND OTHERS v. THE CZECH REPUBLIC
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses (domestic proceedings) - claim dismissed;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE respectively and live in Prostějov except for the sixth applicant who lives in PERSON Ohří .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants lodged with ORG ( okresní soud ) a claim against ORG for damages caused by a violation of their personal rights and an unlawful court decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( krajský soud ) referred the matter to ORG ( městský soud ) which , in a decision of DATE , having received the defendant ’s observations on DATE , separated that part of the action relating to the damage caused by a violation of personal rights and transferred it to ORG . On DATE ORG decided to send certain of the applicants’ claims contained in this part of their action back to ORG . This decision became effective on DATE .

CARDINAL . At a hearing held on DATE ORG heard the first CARDINAL applicants ; the sixth applicant was to be heard by FAC ( okresní soud ) . It appears from TIME the fourth applicant did not attend the hearing . According to the Government , as the fifth applicant had not attended the hearing , he submitted his written statement on DATE . On DATE the first and second applicants supplemented the action .
CARDINAL . In the meantime , on DATE , ORG had requested ORG , ORG and ORG ( Vrchní soud ) to submit some documents .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG contacted ORG and ORG in order to obtain information concerning other judicial proceedings initiated by the applicants . On DATE it re - contacted ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , at ORG request of DATE , heard the sixth applicant who , on DATE , supplemented the action . ORG sent this document to the other parties to the proceedings on DATE , after the applicant having submitted the appropriate number of her supplement .

CARDINAL . On DATE the second applicant supplemented the action through the fourth applicant . On DATE ORG held a hearing which was adjourned in order to gather evidence and to clarify the stage of the other proceedings which the applicants had concurrently instituted . The fourth applicant did not attend the hearing .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants’ lawyer , who did not have a power of attorney signed by the fourth applicant , asked for the latter ’s psychiatric examination . On DATE the first and second applicants requested that the first and fourth applicants be heard in their home .
CARDINAL . On DATE an attempt to hear the fourth applicant was made .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG contacted ORG ( zdravotní středisko ) with a view to obtaining information about the fourth applicant ’s state of health . On DATE it asked ORG whether proceedings on limitation of the fourth applicant ’s capacity to act had been instituted . Having received a negative reply , it invited the applicants’ lawyer , on DATE , to consider whether the other applicants could act as the fourth applicant ’s guardians in the proceedings . On DATE the lawyer informed the court that the second applicant would be ready to undertake this function . However , on DATE ORG informed the lawyer that this would not be possible due to the risk of a conflict of interest . On DATE the lawyer informed the court that the family was looking for a guardian .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG asked ORG to appoint a guardian to defend the fourth applicant ’s interests . On DATE ORG appointed the second applicant to represent the fourth applicant , finding that there was not any risk of a conflict of interest . On DATE ORG , having asked to have been provided with the case - file on DATE , sent it back to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG lawyer submitted final written pleadings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the fourth applicant gave a power of attorney to the lawyer . On DATE , ORG held a hearing , at which it invited the applicants’ lawyer to submit a supplementary statement , which the lawyer did on DATE . However , on DATE the court asked him to explain the meaning of his statement .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , taking into account the aforesaid statement of the applicants’ lawyer , interpreted this as a withdrawal of the claims of the third , fourth , fifth and sixth applicants and discontinued the proceedings in respect of these claims . The decision became effective on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG requested the first and second applicants to specify of their claims for damages . On DATE their lawyer requested the court to extend the time - limit for that purpose .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG discontinued the proceedings in respect of the claims of the first and second applicants due to their failure to specify their claims .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared that it was not territorially competent to deal with the applicants’ action for protection of their personal rights and transferred it to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , having received the case - file on DATE , quashed the aforesaid decision and on DATE remitted it to ORG for further consideration .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants were invited to supplement their action , which they did on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG separated certain of the applicants’ claims for a separate hearing . On DATE it declared that it was not territorially competent to deal with the case and transferred it to ORG , which did not agree with the transfer and brought the competence conflict to ORG . On DATE ORG held that ORG was competent to deal with the applicants’ case .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a hearing . On DATE the first applicant , not having attended the hearing , submitted his written statement .

CARDINAL . Another hearing was held on DATE . The court requested the applicants to pay court fees . On DATE the applicants’ lawyer disagreed and CARDINAL of the applicants appealed against the request .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE the judge dealing with the applicants’ case was sick .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG appeal was sent to ORG , which on DATE returned the case - file to ORG with a request to remove certain formal shortcomings .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG invited the applicants to complete their action and , on DATE , requested the applicants’ lawyer to clarify his previous pleadings . The lawyer complied on DATE . As the first applicant had died on DATE , the lawyer modified and extended the applicants’ original action on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG separated certain of the applicants’ claims for a separate hearing . DATE , it requested the applicants to specify their action . The applicants’ lawyer replied on DATE .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE the judge dealing with the case was sick .
CARDINAL . It seems that the proceedings are still pending .
